alert.note: Alert for Henry; Rock Island; Whiteside (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 02 at 9:36PM CST until January 08 at 8:00PM CST by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...The Flood Watch continues for the following rivers in Illinois... Rock River near Joslin affecting Henry IL, Whiteside and Rock Island Counties. .Forecast moderate to locally heavy rainfall tonight into Tuesday morning, combined with ice action may produce flooding on the Rock River near Joslin by mid week. At this time, there is limited confidence associated with rainfall amounts, extent of run-off, and location of predicted rainfall. Ice action may also be a factor in alternating river levels. As the forecast becomes more certain, this watch will either be upgraded to a flood warning or cancelled. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY EVENING TO SUNDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Rock River near Joslin. * WHEN...From Wednesday evening to Sunday evening. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, flooding of unprotected agricultural land occurs. Water also affects Lundeens Landing Campground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 PM CST Monday, the stage was 11.5 feet and steadily decreasing. - Ice action may produce fluctuations of a foot or more from the expected river rise and crest levels. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached Wednesday evening. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/quadcities. The next statement will be issued Tuesday afternoon.
